name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoic acid has a melting point of 120-122 degrees Celsius. The methyl ester group (COC(=O)) is a common functional group that increases the melting point due to the introduction of a polar carbonyl group and the loss of a hydrogen bond donor. The methyl ester group is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 10-20 degrees Celsius.
